answers.text:
Hello:
There was a similar question asked on the Knowledge Network a few weeks ago. This question dealt with sponsorships of parks and recreation facilities: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/21626/Park_sponsorship_corporate_and_citizen
In addition this article may provide more resources for you to continue your search. It talks about cities selling assets to generate revenue. They talk about toll roads specifically, but I thought it might help lead you to more of what you are looking for:
http://americancityandcounty.com/publicworks/government_selling_public_assets
Peggy Chasler
Knowledge Network Intern
pchasler@icma.org

Kevin - in 1998 Oxnard, CA transfered management of performing arts venue from city to a nonprofit firm.  Public Services Director Matthew Winegar was part of the transfer/agreement not sure he is still at the city?
This is a link to an article discussing a couple different Performing Arts centers going thru transition and moving toward private and/or non profits to manage the centers:  http://www.thedailypage.com/isthmus/article.php?article=34405

author: Kevin Safine
text:
The City of Walnut Creek, California is interested in learning about public agencies that have transitioned an art gallery and/or performing arts center to a privately operated organization. 
If your agency has formerly operated such an arts center (or if you know of one) and the operation and management was transferred to a separate entity, whether the center is still owned by the agency or not, could you please share the details with me?  
Thanks very much,
title: Arts Center Transitioned to Private Entity?
